lenders.name: Uncle Bay
lenders.loan_because: When I was a child I used to play in a marching band. One day when I was going to play my tuba in a parade. I hurt my foot and was unable to play. An angel appeared and told me to forget the tuba and save the world.  I want this to remind me of that time in my life so I can help others. There is no greater sense of human worth as there is with self gratification.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a retired truck driver who has driven many freeway miles and never had an accident, except once or twice.  I like to philosophize in numerous ways and accents.

lenders.name: Serendipity
lenders.loan_because: ...every bit helps

lenders.name: Michelle Hight
lenders.loan_because:
.
My very entrepreneurial dad died when I was young,  putting my mother and my nine brothers and sisters in a precarious and challenging position.  During his lifetime, he taught me the value of entrepreneurship.  In the wake of his death, and for many years after, I was shown the beauty and the sharing of humanity, as friends and neighbors opened their hearts... and their wallets... to my mom, brothers and sisters. They provided opportunity, employment, love, prayers and support.

I loan as a way to "complete the circle". It is gratifying to be able to give in a way that empowers, especially to widows with children. I started by investing in  the dreams of a few entrepreneurs via Kiva. Then I read a few more stories that tugged at my heart, so I loaned a bit more. I'll keep loaning, and loaning and loaning...!  It is so cool to know I can affect the lives of 100, or 1000, or maybe even 10,000 entrepreneurs in my lifetime!  

After I did my first loan, I sent the Kiva link to friends, hoping they would get want to help change a life or two with not a whole lot of work... maybe loan $25 or $50. I hoped they would tell THEIR friends,  and their friends would tell THEIR friends. 

I have a standing offer to anyone I introduce to the site that if they can't afford to be without their $25 for a few months, I will loan it to them, and they can can pay me back when the loan is paid off!  And if I introduce them, and I see that they have not loaned, or borrowed money from me to loan...well, then I take them off my list of friends... :) Well...maybe not completely...but I will give them a hard time about it!

So here's to 10,000 loans! We'd better get busy! We've got a whole lotta ground to cover!

Cheers!
lenders.occupational_info: I help people start and thrive in business.

lenders.name: Pat
lenders.loan_because: I can. And the people I see and the stories I read inspire hope.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a project manager for data and computer networks, that enable people to communicate with each other, and save and find information.

lenders.name: Emily
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: Noisette Davies
lenders.loan_because: if I help people in less fortunate areas, then their pets will also be better off because of it.

lenders.name: Erin
lenders.loan_because: I first recieved as a gift and now I am absolutely amazed at how hard others are working to make a life for themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a director of a child care center

lenders.name: Ben's Memere
lenders.loan_because: my son was a Kiva Fellow in Sierra Leone and he introduced me to microfinance.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach inmates at an all-women high-security prison.

lenders.name: Wien/Mazzucca
lenders.loan_because: you can lend  a little -- over and over again -- and it can make a BIG impact!
lenders.occupational_info: Teachers and students working together to change the world!

lenders.name: Lisa
lenders.loan_because: I am blessed, and I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I design software products, hopefully, ---- based on the consideration of an individual's or group's needs, desires, beliefs, knowledge, skills, experiences, and perceptions.

lenders.name: Melinda
lenders.loan_because: I believe that we should be the change we want to see.

lenders.name: Peter
lenders.loan_because: it's not all about me.

lenders.name: Willie
lenders.loan_because: It's easy. People have given me  larger breaks than a 25,00$ loan. Why not?  I like the idea that the money can, and will likely, stay in kiva and recycle to other projects. It's the loan that keeps on loaning....So it's a small thing, added to a bunch of other small things....adds up.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a lighting technician. I install  electrical power cables, focus  lighting instruments, apply correcting and control media to lighting instruments, make coffee for the boss to keep him smiling ;) .

lenders.name: Bjorn
lenders.loan_because: I have respect for entrepreneurs and I want to support their businesses.
lenders.occupational_info: I create software that interacts with pacemaker and defibrillator systems.

lenders.name: Sarah
lenders.loan_because: I want to loan because I admire these entrepreneurs very much and strive to have the same determination to succeed as they do.
lenders.occupational_info: I am studying nursing in order to work in a hospital to care for people when they need it most.

lenders.name: The Snyder Family
lenders.loan_because: To make an immediate and lasting difference in the world.
lenders.occupational_info: Corporate financial consulting and analysis

lenders.name: Steve
lenders.loan_because: I love to be able to help others that are less fortunate than I am.  As soon as I read about Kiva I knew I would become a lender.  I hope to be able to give many loans to more people al over the world.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because:
There comes a time when we must stop taking and begin giving back. We do this for the people we are helping, for the example we give to our children and so that we can smile when we close our eyes.

Peace,
david
lenders.occupational_info: I trade commodities during the day and write the rest of the time. I have a column in one magazine and write for several others. But my true love is writing novels. I've written three and am working on my fourth. I hope this one will get some attention and get picked-up by an agent and a publisher.

lenders.name: Sharon
lenders.loan_because: it's the simple things you do in life that have the greatest impact, affecting us all directly or indirectly.

lenders.name: Jenny
lenders.loan_because: it changes someone else's life and mine.

lenders.name: William
lenders.loan_because: I believe we have a responsibility to bring the incredible power of individual entrepreneurship to people around the world who are not as fortunate as we are.
lenders.occupational_info: I run a non-profit that provides one on one, arts-based mentoring to under-served public school students in Los Angeles.

lenders.name: Elaine
lenders.loan_because: I am thankful for what I have, believe in the multiplier effect, and feel great about empowering women.

lenders.name: Thao
lenders.loan_because: I understand how crucial the initial capital is. To my best ability, I want to help people to start their business and have a better life. Moreover, I believe that everyone can help others, no matter how big or small the act is! Love and empathy count!
lenders.occupational_info:
I love to physically, volunteer to help poor and homeless people, especially with medical need. Financially, I am far from being rich. In fact, I also have to take many big loans for my oversea education (I'm from Vietnam, and studying in the US). However, it doesn't stop me from helping others as much as I can, as many ways as I know, because I believe that good deeds are passed on, and maybe returned!
Good luck to you all!

lenders.name: Kathleen
lenders.loan_because: This site is unique and it is amazing to see how much change can happen when the 'bank' is no longer an institution but composed of socially conscious people on the internet.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for an 'ethical bank' in Vancouver, Canada where I handle the administration of 'environmentally minded' loans to customers throughout Canada.

lenders.name: Sandie
lenders.loan_because: I care
lenders.occupational_info: Education non-profit

lenders.name: Sarah
lenders.loan_because: It's a cool and awesome way to help others!  Which is something I am passionate about -- no matter where/who/what the people are.  Also, I have been helped in the past -- why not turn around and pass it forward!!!
lenders.occupational_info: I currently work on a legal research website.  It's a pretty awesome computer science type job.  I have a 18 year son who is my "real" job in life and two dogs.

lenders.name: Judie
lenders.loan_because: I honor the divine in you as the same divine that is in me, and we are one.
lenders.occupational_info: I do my best to be All That I am in every moment and do my best to see All that each person is.

lenders.name: Mike M. & family
lenders.loan_because: We love KIVA -- our small loans can make a huge difference to people in other parts of the world.  Reading KIVA stories is so encouraging.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with teenage students with mental and physical handicaps.  My wife is an attorney.  We have 2 sons, one 21 and one 15 years old.

lenders.name: Edwin
lenders.loan_because: I enjoy seeing the impact of my contributions. I believe in Kiva and Microlending. Quite honestly, I feel guilty about the disparity between my life and the poverty of others.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in the technology and media space. I try to develop fundamental products that have a twist to conventional methods.

lenders.name: Kate
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Sam
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: Sonny
lenders.occupational_info: I make products that help people with diabetes manage their disease.

lenders.name: Ang
lenders.loan_because: 'I wept because I had no shoes, until I saw a man who had no feet' - Persian proverb

lenders.name: Rui
lenders.loan_because: I found here ( with Kiva ), a place where i can directly help people who are doing everything they can to help themselves.

lenders.name: Lloyd
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people who are motivated to help themselves.  Kiva's system is more direct and helpful than normal charity donations, and it is good to be able to choose which projects my money is helping.  Lending money rather than donating helps to prevent dependence on charity and encourages good, sustainable business practices.

lenders.name: Martha
lenders.loan_because: I read Bill Clinton's book Giving and it inspired me.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a property manager for a social housing provider.

lenders.name: Charles Logan Stevens
lenders.loan_because: I am responsible for your well-being.

lenders.name: Ashley
lenders.loan_because: I see the big picture of things :)
lenders.occupational_info: I provide insurance and financial services to help protect everything you've worked so hard for!

lenders.name: Shelley
lenders.loan_because: I am able and there are so many people in need.

lenders.name: Stacey
lenders.loan_because: it keeps me from losing sight of how lucky I am to have been born where and when I was. My grandma taught me at a young age to share with those less fortunate than me, even if I have very little myself.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach English as a foreign language in France. I talk about social, political and cultural issues with twenty-year-olds from around the world.

lenders.name: Amanda
lenders.loan_because: Community is the purpose of life.
lenders.occupational_info:
I teach the past to the future.
I also learn from the future.

lenders.name: Cynthia
lenders.loan_because: I believe that I should share my good fortune with others in the world who are trying to improve their lives, and those of their children and communities

lenders.name: Patrick
lenders.loan_because: People who work hard deserve a chance at success. I want to be a part of sharing my success in life with others in the world.

lenders.name: Christina
lenders.loan_because: I am studying entrepreneurship in the non-profit sector, and this is a good opportunity to work hands-on with a business venture.

lenders.name: Jacqui
lenders.loan_because: I admire hard working people with an entrepreneurial spirit.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in an office during the week and at weekends I follow my real passion which is healing people with Reiki.

lenders.name: Leif
lenders.loan_because: I just wish to be a decent person by sharing a microscopic amount of my surplus with this world´s needy, preferably women and if they are sole bread-winners "I´m their man".
lenders.occupational_info: Used to work as an accountant

lenders.name: Jeff
lenders.loan_because: Enough micro-loans in a small village could create a small vibrant self sustaining economy and improve the quality of life for everyone.
lenders.occupational_info: Basketball fan...that's all there is to life.

lenders.name: Sean
lenders.loan_because: I believe I am making a difference helping others.
lenders.occupational_info: Telecommunications

lenders.name: Steve
lenders.loan_because: I like helping others, especially entrepreneurs in a situation that does not lend easy access to credit.

lenders.name: Paul
lenders.loan_because: I should
lenders.occupational_info: running a consultancy company

lenders.name: Dorothee
lenders.loan_because: You Have To Give People Something To Dream on. (Jimi Hendrix)

lenders.name: Mallory
lenders.loan_because: Jesus teaches, by example, to help others.
lenders.occupational_info: I go to school.

lenders.name: Steen
lenders.loan_because: it is the right thing to do in putting money to the most effective use in other people's lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with building computers that will hopefully make the world a better place.

lenders.name: Jean
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: bill
lenders.loan_because: Just Want To.

lenders.name: joshua
lenders.occupation: full time meat cutter, full time student

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: I've read a lot about microfinance and would like to try lending myselves.

lenders.name: Mitch
lenders.loan_because: it's the responsibility of all people to love their neighbors
lenders.occupational_info: I work in the loan department of a regional bank.

lenders.name: Our Spanish Class
lenders.loan_because: GIVING IS KIND
lenders.occupational_info: Seventh grade Spanish Class learning about the culture and language of Spanish speaking countries

lenders.name: Charlene
lenders.loan_because: I feel drawn to others who are working hard to achieve their goals and dreams.  Namaste.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as the assistant to the CEO of a public medical device company.

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.loan_because: I want to help those who want to help themselves.

lenders.name: Aurélia & students
lenders.loan_because: I worked with one of my classes on the 'pay it forward' concept, and a friend of mine (Hi Dan!) told me about this project he had in mind: He's a teacher as well, and said a good idea would be to get the students involved in a Kiva project, asking them to decide which person most needed a loan at a given time. He would personally give $50 of his own money to that person. I made it $100, and all the kids chipped in to raise another $100, so we were able to lend $200 between us. We hope that the group will find a final lender soon!

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: This is the best way to reach those in the greatest need.
lenders.occupational_info: I write textbooks on statistical methods in the behavioral sciences

lenders.name: Purna Ravi Kumar
lenders.loan_because: I have Netcenter with 8 systems.I want to add 2 more systems and modify my shop little.
lenders.occupational_info:
I provide net service to students,housewifes & job seekers.
I am in the business for 6years.I provide service at reasonable rate.

lenders.name: Kay & Don West
lenders.loan_because: We believe that working capital partnered with vision and hard work can turn dreams into powerful creations.   Participating as micro-lenders we are changing the stars and altering the course for those who receive assistance and faithfully discharge the stewardship necessary to make an enterprise be successful.
lenders.occupational_info: We create where there was not, we change for the better where there is...

lenders.name: Larry
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: Yoav
lenders.loan_because: So little can do so much.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach economics in a mid-size university on the East Coast of the United States. In addition to teaching, I work on various research and service projects, like running workshops on personal finance.

lenders.name: Allana
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the power of the human spirit, and that culture is strengthened by individuals who have the desire to change their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a university student and single mother.

lenders.name: Kim
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with children to help them talk and communicate.

lenders.name: Jen
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Edmeston Interact Club
lenders.loan_because: giving of what we have to help others become self-sufficient is important to us.
lenders.occupational_info: We are a community based teen service club affiliated with Rotary International.
